  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath4 be a 3-dimensional handlebody of genus @xmath0 , and @xmath5 be the boundary surface @xmath6 .",
    "we denote by @xmath7 the mapping class group of @xmath5 , the group of isotopy classes of orientation preserving homeomorphisms of @xmath5 .",
    "dehn @xcite proved that @xmath7 is generated by finitely many dehn twists .",
    "furthermore lickorish @xcite proved that @xmath8 dehn twists generate @xmath7 .",
    "humphries @xcite found that @xmath9 dehn twists generate @xmath7 . + we denote by @xmath10 the handlebody mapping class group , the subgroup of mapping class group @xmath7 of boundary surface @xmath6 defined by isotopy classes of those orientation preserving homeomorphisms of @xmath6 which can be extended to homeomorphisms of @xmath4 .",
    "it turns out that @xmath10 can be identified with the group of isotopy classes of orientation preserving homeomorphisms of @xmath4 .",
    "a finite presentation of the handlebody mapping class group @xmath10 was obtained by wajnryb @xcite .",
    "let @xmath4 and @xmath11 be 3-dimensional handlebodies , and @xmath12 be a heegaard splitting of a closed orientable @xmath1-manifold @xmath13 .",
    "let @xmath7 be the mapping class group of the boundary surface @xmath14 .",
    "the group of mapping classes @xmath15 \\in { \\mathcal}{m}_g$ ] such that there is an orientation preserving self - homeomorphism @xmath16 of @xmath17 satisfying @xmath18=[f]$ ] is called the genus-@xmath0 goeritz group of @xmath12 .",
    "when a manifold @xmath13 admits a unique heegaard splitting of genus @xmath0 up to isotopy , we can define the genus-@xmath0 goeritz group of the manifold without mentioning a specific splitting .",
    "for example , the @xmath1-sphere , @xmath19 and lens spaces are known to be such manifolds from @xcite , @xcite and @xcite .    in studying goeritz groups , finding their generating sets or presentations",
    "has been an interesting problem .",
    "however the generating sets or the presentation of those groups have been obtained only for a few manifolds with their splittings of small genera .",
    "a finite presentation of the genus-2 goeritz group of 3-sphere was obtained @xcite . in an arbitrary genus , first powell @xcite and",
    "then hirose @xcite claimed that they have found a finite generating set for the genus-@xmath0 goeritz group of 3-sphere , though serious gaps in both arguments were found by scharlemann .",
    "establishing the existence of such generating sets appears to be an open problem .",
    "in addition , finite presentations of the genus-2 goeritz groups of each lens spaces @xmath20 were obtained @xcite , other lens spaces were obtained @xcite and the genus-@xmath3 heegaard splittings of non - prime @xmath1-manifolds were obtained . recently a finite presentation of the genus-2 goeritz group of @xmath19 was obtained .",
    "computing homology of mapping class groups is interesting topic of studying mapping class groups .",
    "harer @xcite determined the second homology group of mapping class group @xmath7 :    @xmath21    in fact , harer proved a more general theorem for surfaces with multiple boundary components and arbitrarily many punctures .",
    "in twisted case , morita @xcite determined the first homology group with coefficients in the first integral homology group of the surface :    @xmath22    recently ishida and sato computed the twisted first homology groups of the handlebody mapping class group @xmath10 with coefficients in the first integral homology group of the boundary surface @xmath5 :    @xmath23      let @xmath4 and @xmath11 be 3-dimensional handlebodies , and @xmath25 be the heegaard splitting of the @xmath1-sphere @xmath24 .",
    "waldhausen @xcite proved that a genus-@xmath0 heegaard splitting of @xmath24 is unique up to isotopy .",
    "let @xmath7 be the mapping class group of the boundary surface @xmath14 .",
    "the group of mapping classes @xmath15 \\in { \\mathcal}{m}_g$ ] such that there is an orientation preserving self - homeomorphism @xmath16 of @xmath26 satisfying @xmath18=[f]$ ] is denoted by @xmath2 .",
    "it is called the genus-@xmath0 goeritz group of the @xmath1-sphere .      in this paper",
    ", we compute the twisted first homology group of @xmath27 with coefficients in the first integral homology group of the heegaard surface @xmath28 .",
    "the following is the main theorem in this paper .",
    "@xmath29    a finite presentation of the genus-2 goeritz group of the 3-sphere was obtained from the works of @xcite . for the higher genus goeritz",
    "groups of the 3-sphere , it is conjectured that all of them are finitely presented however it is still known to be an open problem .",

    "the homeomorphism @xmath58 is a @xmath60 rotation of the handlebody about the vertical @xmath61-axis .",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> given a genus-@xmath0 heegaard splitting of a @xmath1-sphere , the genus-@xmath0 goeritz group @xmath2 is defined to be the group of the isotopy classes of orientation preserving homeomorphism of the @xmath1-sphere that preserve the splitting . in this paper , we determine the twisted first ( co)homology group of the genus-@xmath3 goeritz group of @xmath1-sphere . </S>"
  ]
}
